intro: Anagallis monelli var. microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf strawberry flower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that resemble miniature strawberries. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pink to red in color with five petals. Anagallis monelli var. microphylla is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
